ledger

Class Ledger

  • java.lang.Object
    • ledger.Ledger

  • public class Ledger
extends Object
    The Ledger class is shared by all States and used to keep track of all key-value entries that a node contains. It includes methods to determine if a Ledger is out of sync with the cluster.
    Author:
    deenaariff

        public Ledger()
        The Constructor for the Ledger Class

    • Method Detail

      • getLogs

        public List<Log> getLogs(int start_index,
                         int num_logs)
        Get the Logs in that are in the interval of a given start index, to the # num_logs after that
        Parameters:
        start_index - The start index of the first log to get
        num_logs - The number of logs to get from the given start index
        Returns:
        a List of Log for the given start_index and num_logs

      • addToLogs

        public void addToLogs(Log value)
        This method is called by client to add new log to the list of logs. This will be replicated to followers.
        Parameters:
        value - The Log to append to this nodes logs

      • receiveConfirmation

        public void receiveConfirmation(HeartBeat hb,
                                RoutingTable rt)
        Receive a 'True' Heartbeat Message from a Follower and update Ledger accordingly. Will Update nextIndex[] and matchIndex[] in the Routing table based off number of entries in hb. Will update the commitIndex if a majority of servers have committed at a given index by calling updateCommitIndex()
        Parameters:
        hb - the HeartBeat (response to AppendEntries RPC) to be confirmed by the leader
        rt - the RoutingTable to determine majority of cluster for commiting Log

      • confirmMatch

        public Boolean confirmMatch(int index,
                            Log term)
        Confirms whether a Log at a given index matches the equivalent Log in the ledger
        Parameters:
        index - the index at which to confirm a match for a given Log entry
        term - the Log entry to match at the provided index
        Returns:
        returns a Boolean based upon whether the term matches the logs at the given index

      • syncCommitIndex

        public void syncCommitIndex(int leader_commit_index)
        Given the commit Index from a Leader, update the commit index to be the min of the last applied log to our ledger and the leader's commit index.
        Parameters:
        leader_commit_index - the leader_commit_index to update the follower's commit index

      • update

        public void update(HeartBeat hb)
        This method is used by followers, and updates the ledger based on the heartbeat. It iterates through all of the new commits sent from the leader, and adds it to the logs and key store
        Parameters:
        hb - The heartbeat message sent from the leader

      • getLogbyIndex

        public Log getLogbyIndex(int index)
        Get the Log at a Given Index
        Parameters:
        index - The index to obtain a certain log in the node's logs
        Returns:
        returns a Log that is at the given index in the node's logs

      • getLastLog

        public Log getLastLog()
        Get the last log in the ledger
        Returns:
        returns a Log at the end of the node's Logs

      • validateVote

        public boolean validateVote(Vote vote)
        Method for follower to validate Candidate's vote If Candidate's log is at least as up to date as receiver's log grant vote
        Parameters:
        vote - The Vote to validate given the node's terms and last Log Term
        Returns:
        returns a boolean one whether this vote is validated by the ledger's info

      • getKeyStore

        public Map<String,String> getKeyStore()
        Returns:
        returns a Map that represents this node's key store

      • getCommitIndex

        public int getCommitIndex()
        Returns:
        returns the current commit index of this node

      • getLastApplied

        public int getLastApplied()
        Returns:
        returns the last index applied in the node's logs
